---
title: "Importation"
output: html_notebook
---

```{r}
library(knitr)
```


Can I import a function (say) from another file?

I have a function `squareit` in another file `import2.R`:

```{bash}
cat import2.R
```

The easiest way is just to source the other file:


```{r}
source("import2.R")
squareit(3)
rm(squareit)
```

gone?

```{r}
squareit(3)
```


```{r setup, echo=FALSE}
opts_chunk$set(echo = FALSE, cache=FALSE)
read_chunk('import2.R')
```

get the function and run it

```{r thesquare}
```


```{r}
squareit(3)
```

```{r}
rm(squareit)
```

gone again?

```{r}
squareit(3)
```
